overview:
Tom Ingersoll is an aerospace veteran and entrepreneur with more than 25 years of experience in the space and communications industry. He is responsible for growing Skybox Imaging from its current development phase to full commercial operations and to the deployment of the world’s largest commercial imaging constellation.

Most recently he was cofounder and CEO of Universal Space Network (USN), a leading provider of global ground station services to the satellite industry. He led the growth of USN from start-up to become the leading supplier of mission critical ground station services to NASA, the US DoD and international satellite operators. Previously he was a senior manager in the Phantomworks of McDonnell Douglas Corporation where he served as program manager for several fast paced space flight programs. He has worked extensively with the international space community to provide reliable systems and services.

Tom holds a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering Cum Laude and a Master’s degree in Engineering Management, both from Brigham Young University. In his spare time, Tom enjoys spending time with his family & mountain biking.
